newsitem.title: USA: Jobless rate edges up to 5.4 percent in January.
newsitem.headline: Jobless rate edges up to 5.4 percent in January.

text.p: The unemployment rate edged up to 5.4 percent last month from 5.3 percent in December, even though the economy created more jobs than it has since last summer, the government said on Friday.

In the government's first reading of the nation's economic health in January, the Labor Department reported that 271,000 non-farm jobs were created, the most since August, after payrolls grew by 261,000 jobs in December.
